page.title: 01North-East Kirkcaldy
page.content: The largest part of this area is arable farm land producing cereals.The {Frances}colliery which is currently under care and maintenance is on the coast.The mine was closed during the national strike but coal can still be brought out through Seafield pit which is two miles away.The village of{ {Dysart},which is now part of Kirkcaldy,lies on the coast beside the mine and is the home of {John {McDouall-Stuart}who explored central Australia .The Mitchelston }Industrial Estate was set up in the 1960s and has on it International companies such as {GEC} and{McIntosh's }the furniture manufacturers.The residential part of the area is mostly pre-war housing.The most important lesiure features are the Ice-rink and two parks.
